description.narrative: Overall, the work will support key stakeholders to the peace process, to address issues of the illicit economy in mediations and through this, foster more comprehensive peace negotiations. The series of expert sessions with key targeted stakeholders are likely to include: > Members of the Follow-up Committee (Comité de Suivi ) > Members of the mediation team engaged in the Algiers process and/or their support staff Office of the Special Representative of the Secretary General to Mali > Strategic personnel at MINUSMA > UN DPA and DPKO as well as UNDP staff following the process > EU officials and other key international ‘Friends’ of the process, including Heads of Diplomatic Missions to Mali and Delegations at Embassies > Officials from other regional organisations party to the process; > if possible Malian actors particularly civil society actors.

The action proposed is designed to contribute to the sustainability of peace in Mali, in which the EU has invested considerably. It is designed to transfer cutting-edge expertise on tackling organised crime to strategically placed individuals involved the follow-up to the Algiers Peace Accord. It could lay a foundation for a larger follow-up process of researching, supporting and monitoring Mali’s efforts to tackle organised crime as part of building peace in the immediate post-conflict phase, working with larger sections of society.
